items.message: Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 11 November 2025 and 12 November 2025.  Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Areas most at risk include low lying land in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Further flooding is possible tomorrow as river levels rise due to additional rainfall.  We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and will issue further alerts and warnings if required.  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and consider activating any flood protection products you may have.  This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from overnight on 11 November 2025 . 
Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Shipton under Wychwood area. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We expect river levels to begin rising overnight on 11/11/2025. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 11 and 12 November 2025. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land, roads and paths near rivers; including roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges.
Further flooding is possible tomorrow as river levels continue to rise due to additional rain. 
 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and will update this message as the situation changes. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and consider activating any flood protection products you may have.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible today, Tuesday 11 November.
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels may remain high over the next couple of days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Wednesday 12 November or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 12 November 2025 . 
Heavy and persistent rainfall is expected on Tuesday evening and overnight. River levels are expected to rise in response to the rainfall.

Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river from around 12:30AM on Wednesday. The main areas of concern are Seaton, Colyton, Axminster and Axmouth.

We expect the river to remain high into Wednesday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Plym, Tory Brook, Long Brook

items.message:
High river levels throughout the evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 11 November 2025 . 
Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the River Plym, Tory Brook and Long Brook from around 9pm on the evening of Tuesday 11 November and remain high overnight into Wednesday 12 November. 
The main areas of concern are low lying riverside locations at Plympton and Marsh Mills.
Heavy and persistent rainfall is expected this afternoon and overnight. 
River levels are expected to rise in response to the rainfall, however, no flooding to properties is currently forecast. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and monitoring rainfall and river levels. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 11 November 2025 . 
Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river from around 10pm on the evening of Tuesday 11 November and remain high overnight into Wednesday 12 November.  

The main areas of concern are Yealmpton, Yealmbridge and Mill Bridge. 

Heavy and persistent rainfall is expected this afternoon and overnight.  

River levels are expected to rise in response to the rainfall.  

We are monitoring river levels and may issue a Flood Warning if required. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 
Flooding is expected on 11 November 2025 from 22:30 this evening. 
Flooding may affect properties and roads around Wentworth Way, Derry Close, Osmaston Road, Arosa Drive, Burnel Road and the A38 Aston Webb Boulevard.

Move family, pets and cars to safety and turn off gas, electricity and water if it is safe to do so and Activate any flood protection products you may have.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible around the high tide on Tuesday evening. 
Areas particularly at risk include Torbay, Teignmouth, Beesands, Torcross, Slapton and Dawlish.
  
The high tide at Exmouth on Tuesday 11 November is at 10:45PM, times of high water will vary along the coast.  Forecast total high tide level is 1.55mAOD, which is 0.47 metres above tide table level.  Force 6 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 2.30 metres are forecast over the high tide.

Coastal conditions should ease for Wednesday morning's high tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
Periods of heavy rain on Tuesday 11th November 2025 will cause the levels in Derwentwater and surrounding rivers to rise throughout the day.
We continue to monitor the situation.
Do not walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 12th November 2025.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High river levels this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 11 November 2025 and 12 November 2025. 
This evening, we have seen heavy rainfall in the area. 
Further heavy rain is forecast tonight and into Wednesday daytime. 
Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river from around 9pm on Tuesday 11 November.  
The main areas of concern are low lying riverside locations at Mary Tavy and near the River Tavy at Tavistock including Abbey Walk, The Meadows and Dolvin Road public amenity areas.  
We expect the river to remain high throughout the night though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and monitoring rainfall and river levels 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses .Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 11 November 2025.

Areas most at risk are those around the River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell, including Dogsmouth Brook. We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. Rainfall forecast later this week will keep levels high.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 on 12 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
